title: DNSKEY Key Tag Calculator
description: Compute the DNSKEY key tag from a DNSKEY RR (RFC 4034 algorithm) and display it alongside key metadata for DNSSEC validation purposes.

ksk.title: KSK Example (Algorithm 8 - RSASHA256)
ksk.description: Key Signing Key with SEP flag set

zsk.title: ZSK Example (Algorithm 13 - ECDSAP256SHA256)
zsk.description: Zone Signing Key for data signing

rdataOnly.title: RDATA Only Format
rdataOnly.description: DNSKEY record data without owner name

input.label: DNSKEY Record
input.tooltip: Enter a DNSKEY record in standard format (e.g., 'example.org. 3600 IN DNSKEY 257 3 8 AwEAAag') to calculate its key tag
input.exampleActive: Using example data - modify to see your results

results.title: Key Tag Calculation
results.keyTagTooltip: A 16-bit identifier calculated from the DNSKEY used to quickly identify which key was used to generate a signature

keyType.label: Key Type
keyType.tooltip: KSK (Key Signing Key) signs other keys and has the SEP flag set (257). ZSK (Zone Signing Key) signs zone data and has no SEP flag (256).

flags.label: Flags
flags.tooltip: 16-bit flags field. Bit 15 (SEP flag) indicates if this is a Key Signing Key. 257 = KSK, 256 = ZSK.

protocol.label: Protocol
protocol.tooltip: Protocol field for DNSKEY records. Must always be 3 (DNSSEC).

algorithm.label: Algorithm
algorithm.tooltip: Cryptographic algorithm used by this key. Common values: 8 (RSASHA256), 13 (ECDSA P-256), 15 (Ed25519).

publicKey.label: Public Key (Base64)
publicKey.tooltip: The actual cryptographic public key data encoded in Base64 format. This is used for signature verification.

purpose.title: Key Tag Purpose
purpose.description: The key tag is a short identifier used to quickly identify which DNSKEY was used to generate a signature. It's calculated using a checksum algorithm defined in RFC 4034 and helps optimize DNSSEC validation by avoiding the need to test every key.

keyTypes.title: Key Types
keyTypes.description: KSK (Key Signing Key): Used to sign other keys (ZSKs). Has the SEP flag set (bit 15). ZSK (Zone Signing Key): Used to sign zone data. Does not have the SEP flag set.

algorithmSupport.title: Algorithm Support
algorithmSupport.description: Supports all modern DNSSEC algorithms including RSASHA256 (8), RSASHA512 (10), ECDSA P-256 (13), ECDSA P-384 (14), and Ed25519 (15). Legacy algorithms like RSAMD5 are deprecated and should not be used.

validation.title: Validation Process
validation.description: The tool validates DNSKEY format, checks protocol compliance (must be 3), verifies algorithm support, and ensures proper base64 encoding of the public key before calculating the key tag.
